column2: Grant an Estate to this character. This will give them a monthly revenue and make them more loyal to you.
Grant an Estate to this character. This will give them a monthly revenue and make them more loyal to you.
Consider the size of the Estate that will be granted to §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! (you will also have the opportunity to reconsider, if you wish).\n
As an adult member of the Wuxia faith, it’s time for you to choose which school of martial arts you will pursue in order to reach Enlightenment.
I will choose my father's sect.
I will choose my mother's sect.
I shall let the gods decide my sect.
Your character is currently retired from their lives as a ruler to train in the martial arts.
As a Wuxia practitioner, you can spend a period of time in training and contemplation.
Your month long training has come to an end, you can now return to your normal life.
I shall return to my normal life.

You have spent the last few days training with [new_sect_friend.GetFirstName] Their skills and yours seem to develop better when you challenge each other, and [new_sect_friend.GetHerHis] has asked you if you wish to train together more often.

You were training at the local monastery of your Sect, when suddenly a person entered from the gate. [new_sect_enemy.GetFirstName] claims that your sect is not the true path to Enlightenment, and challenges your Sect to prove otherwise by facing him in honorable duel.
Or we can all show you.
[new_sect_enemy.GetFirstName] lies defeated on the ground. Before falling unconscious and being escorted outside, he swears revenge on you. You might have made an enemy today…

You fall on your knees, defeated by your opponent’s mastery of martial arts. [new_sect_enemy.GetFirstName] roars in triumph, gloating at his success. As they walk away, your fellow Sect members help you up. They offer words of encouragement, but you can tell they are a bit disappointed.
The time spent Training has proven useful. You can feel your body invigorated, and the soreness in your muscles is gone. Under the guide of your Sect, you have stepped further toward Enlightenment.

Your muscles are sore, your back hurts, and training with the traditional weapons of your Sect has left your hands bloody without being any close to mastering them. Even with the help of your Sect, you don’t feel particularly close to Enlightenment.

Your fellow Sect members have expressed their concerns over your diet. They believe you are spending too much time eating, and not enough time contemplating the meaning of your training. “It is not just power we seek, young man. You must abandon mortal desires if you hope to achieve the true goal of our faith.” A Master wisely warns you.

Your refusal to eat has caught the eyes of several fellow Sect members. Together, they come to you and suggest you should try to eat more. “We admire your dedication to fasting, but it is unwise to weaken yourself by doing so. One must find a fine balance, lest they lose their way toward Enlightenment.” A Master warns you.
I will fast as I see fit.

As the dawn shines through the sky, your night of meditation comes to an end. The morning dew has settled on your brows and air, and you feel one with nature, fully connected with the world around you. As a bird settles on your shoulder, you breath, at peace.

The scorching heat of the sun burns on your shirtless body, but you hold steadfast on your goal. Spending the entire day exposed to the elements in this summer day will strengthen your body and mind. With that in mind, you try to hold your meditative state through the hottest part of the day.

The snow settles on your shoulders and head as you take deep breaths to calm your shivering. Shirtless, you feel the icy wind running on your skin, and the melting droplets of snow descend on your face and body, as it grows colder. You try to hold through the night as your skin grows cold.

You are training by yourself on a peaceful incline not far from the temple, when suddenly an old man sits nearby, watching you. As time passes, you can’t help but notice the intensity of his look. Unable to hold your curiosity, you speak. “Can I help you, sir?” You ask, without interrupting the flow of your training. The man smiles. “I’m a wandering traveller, nothing more.” He replies, “Merely pursuing Enlightenment in my own way.”

After a little longer, the man notices your lack of interest. He stands up, bowing. “May your training prove successful, and your mind grow clearer.” He says, before disappearing down the slope. You wonder who he was. In his stride, however, you recognize the fierce stride of a trained warrior. Perhaps he was more than meets the eye…
May you have a safe travel.

“Your own way?” You ask, wary. It’s not rare for members of rival Sects to ambush each other, and in the way the man carries himself you recognize someone with a mastery of Martial Arts. “My own way. I seek to better myself, not through the Sects, but through my own strength. A lonely path, but a rewarding one.”Those words catch your attention. Is there another path, besides the Sects?

He nods, and lets you sit in front of him. He shares his tales of training alone, in the mountains, tide down by nothing. A path of self-reflection and self-discovery, and a path of developing unique styles of martial arts, personal to him. He tells you the tale of the immortals that can reach the very pinnacle of their strength, the Xian, the masters of Qi Cultivation. As he talks, you grow…
Angry at his words against the Sects, enough to stand up and leave.

He continues explaining, and you find yourself fascinated by the tales of great exploits and by the idea of immortality achieved through lonely training. As he continues, you ask. “Would you teach me the way to reach this goal?”He smiles. “It is not for me to teach, it is for you to learn by yourself. Set forth alone and find your path. The way of Xianxia is arduous, but rewarding.”With those words, he stands up, bows, and before you can say anything more sets on his way.
Dynasty upset for not following sect

It is time to burn away your sins in the holy fire of god, what sins will you erase from your body and soul?
§Y*§! Can burn away sin traits and gain virtue traits through a self targeted self immolation decision.
Sevillians believe that only their Pope can speak the word of god and that thus all Protestant Sects which totally reject the authority of a Pope are worse than the misled Catholics.
Cadaverists believe that only their Pope can speak the word of god and that thus all other Christian sects must be destroyed to make way for his proclaimations from god.
Neo-Donatists believe that only once all follow the Neo-Donatist faith may the world finally reach its conclusion and are willing to reach this goal through holy war.
The Trimurti cults worship one or more of the members of the Trimurti, Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva, either as an individual unified diety or as three related dieties.
The Saraswati cults primarily worship the aforementioned Saraswati goddess of knowledge, learning, music, art and wisdom.
The Cults of the minor deva are an assortment of less popular dieties found across eastern india.
The Krishna cults primarily worship the aforementioned Krishna goddess of protection, compassion, tenderness and love.
The Lakshmi cults primarily worship the aforementioned Lakshmi goddess of wealth, fortune, power, fertility and prosperity.

There are many gods and goddesses amongst the Hindu pantheon which will you choose?

I shall follow one of the minor Devas

Canarians long to return Spain to the flock of the true Pope in Rome and away from the false Pope in Seville.

Catholics believe that only their Pope can speak the word of god and that thus zealous Catholics can strike out against the heretic followers of the Sevillian Papacy.
